name: Unbox
slogan: We build & protect purchasing power through people-centered concepts, software & solutions
description:
At Unbox, we build and market reward & recognition 3.0 for everyone, providing more purchasing power, more time, more loyalty ... and hopefully more happiness and wellbeing.
We created the UCoin® as a carrier for responsible and rewarding purchasing power... and more time. We are a team of multi-national multi-disciplinary entrepreneurs dedicated to our vision. If something were to sum up Unbox in a nutshell, it would be our beliefs.

1 - We believe in equal opportunity because it is the only guarantee for lasting peace.
2 - We challenge the idea that labour and capital should always be rewarded in capital.
3 - We adhere to the logic that governments and employers should positively reward desired changes in behaviour.
4 - We believe "helicopter money" does not work to (re)activate economic activity and desired consumption.

We build and protect purchasing power
through people-centered concepts, software, and solutions.

jobs.title: Designer
jobs.description:
Unbox is looking to recruit an ambitious graphic design interns a with unquenchable thirst for creativity to assist with design needs of the marketing, tech, and operations, and strategy teams. While no professional experience is required, uncompromising professionalism, understanding and subscribing to our beliefs is a must. Attention to detail is paramount as well as a strong sense of accountability and ability to work efficiently on very strict and short-term deadlines. 

This job will require extreme flexibility and capacity to adapt to a changing set of variables at any given time. If this sounds like a description of you please reach out to us at jobs@unbox.work with your CV, portfolio and any other relevant documents.  We look forward to hearing from you! 

Must haves 
-	Digital design knowhow with an emphasis on UI/UX
-	Some experience with designing with the web (google fonts etc.) 
-	Pixel-perfect accuracy 
-	Able to read and write (and work!) in English
-	Able to devise and develop creative concepts
-	Knowledge of programs like Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign 
-	Ability to process feedback efficiently and with an eye for detail
-	Respect of deadlines
-	Work together with Marketing, Operations and Sales team 
-	Knowledge of Google Web Designer, After Effects, online and social media platforms
-	Must subscribe to our four beliefs
-	Able to work remotely 

Nice to haves 
-	Dutch or French speaking 
-	Based in Europe 
-	Good communications skills
-	Good writing skills

jobs.title: Experienced Front-End Web Developer
jobs.description:
Unbox is recruiting a Front-End Web Developer required to support the design and implementation of web-based client solutions; built on top of our existing & evolving feature-rich framework. 

This job will require extreme flexibility and capacity to adapt to a changing set of variables at any given time. If this sounds like a description of you please reach out to us at jobs@unbox.work with your CV, portfolio and any other relevant documents. We look forward to hearing from you!

**Essentials**
•	Experience with JavaScript  
•	Able to debug JavaScript on multiple platforms  
•	Good understanding of HTML & CSS, including browser quirks  
•	Understanding of cross browser CSS3 (Gradients, Rounded Corners)  
•	Knowledge of web based systems architecture  
•	Knowledge of HTML5 technologies (SVG, Canvas, Video)  
•	Object Oriented JavaScript design strategies  
•	Commercial experience with JavaScript: jQuery / YUI / XHR, RequireJS  
•	Excellent communication skills  
•	Driven, enthusiastic character with a passion and desire to learn  
•	At least 3 years commercial experience  
•	Accuracy  

**Nice-to-haves**
•	Experience with MVC  
•	Experience with MySQL & PHP or similar  
•	Experience with Cordova and Ionic  
•	Experience with Sass  
•	Experience with Angular, React, Vue.js  
•	Understanding of Grunt, Bower and Node.js  
•	Experience with version control: SVN or GIT  

**Not the actual salary and we don't recommend you apply due to it. Instead, think of whether you are a good fit for the Unbox's beliefs & mission.**

jobs.title: Technical Project Manager / Business Analyst
jobs.description:
This job will require extreme flexibility and capacity to adapt to a changing set of variables at any given time. If this sounds like a description of you please reach out to us at jobs@unbox.work with your CV, portfolio and any other relevant documents. We look forward to hearing from you!

Unbox is recruiting a Technical Project Manager / Business Analyst to join our Technology team to support the development of web-based solutions; built on top of an existing & evolving feature-rich framework. The role includes pro-active project management and delivery within budget, quality and time parameters. Within this pivotal role, you will be responsible for fully gathering customer requirements in order to complete the business analysis and solution design phases of a project. 

Essentials 
•	At least 3 years of experience as a Technical Project Manager / Business Analyst 
•	Strong business analyst background with a focus on technology  
•	Experience of the full requirements lifecycle (i.e. elicitation, documentation,  specification)  
•	Skilled in writing complex specification documents (including process flows &  wireframes)  
•	Experience of a range of methodologies and SDLCs  
•	Knowledge of web-based systems architecture  
•	Strong analytical skills with an ability to use a logical approach to problem solving  
•	Excellent communication skills  
•	Significant experience of meeting facilitation  
•	Experience of leading small to medium sized projects  
•	Driven, enthusiastic character with a passion and desire to learn  
•	Team player who enjoys working in a busy environment 

Nice-to-haves  
•	Commercial experience of using UML (specifically documenting use cases)  
•	Prior experience of working with remote delivery teams  
•	Experience with HTML, JavaScript & CSS  
•	Some experience with XML schemas

jobs.title: Experienced PHP / MySQL developer
jobs.description:
Unbox is recruiting a LAMP developer required to further develop and maintain custom web platforms in tandem with the current developers. 

This job will require extreme flexibility and capacity to adapt to a changing set of variables at any given time. If this sounds like a description of you please reach out to us at jobs@unbox.work with your CV and any other relevant documents. We look forward to hearing from you!

**Essentials**
•	At least 10 years commercial experience developing object-oriented PHP code, interfaces, abstracts and exception handling
•	Detailed knowledge of MVC development, best practices and structure
•	Awareness of the latest developments and upcoming changes in PHP
•	Must write clean, concise, well-documented and reusable code
•	Commercial experience with jQuery, AJAX, JSON and related technologies
•	Good understanding of HTML & CSS
•	Good communication skills in English
•	Experience with version control: SVN or GIT
•	Driven, enthusiastic character with a passion and desire to learn
•	Accuracy

**Nice-to-haves**
•	Zend Framework Certification
•	Practical experience with PHP PSR coding styles and standards
•	Knowledge of web-based systems architecture
•	Knowledge of HTML5 technologies (SVG, Canvas, Video)
•	Object Oriented JavaScript design strategies
•	Experience with JavaScript: jQuery / Underscore / IUI / XHR, RequireJS
•	Understanding of cross browser CSS3 (Gradients, Rounded Corners)
•	Experience with PHP 7
•	Experience with Laravel / Lumen
•	Experience with AWS
•	Experience with CSS compilers: Sass, Less, PostCSS
•	Experience with Active Records, R/W database separation or application level DB sharding
•	Practical knowledge of Grunt, Bower, Node.js
•	Understanding of Angular, React, Vue.js
